faqs.question: What is the typical lease duration for a Shop For Rent in Sector 87
faqs.answer: Most standard commercial leases in Sector 87 Gurugram are structured for 3 years with an option to renew based on mutual agreement between the landlord and the tenant. Shorter leases like 11 months are rare for high-value retail spaces but may be negotiated for smaller kiosks. We typically recommend a 3-year minimum to ensure your business has sufficient time to establish itself and capitalize on the high local foot traffic available in this developing sector without frequent relocation costs.

faqs.question: Are there specific commercial zones designated within Sector 87
faqs.answer: Yes Sector 87 has clearly designated commercial belts primarily along the main arterial roads and within integrated residential projects like high-rise societies. The high-street market facing the main bypass road tends to command higher rental values due to extreme visibility while shops within organized market complexes offer specialized environments and structured customer access. We can help identify the zone best suited for your business type and target audience.

faqs.question: What are the expected costs beyond the monthly rental price
faqs.answer: Beyond the base rent tenants should budget for maintenance charges usually covering common area security cleaning and lift operations. Additionally you will be responsible for electricity water consumption and applicable Goods and Services Tax GST on the rental amount. Typically a security deposit equivalent to 3 to 6 months rent is also required upfront when finalizing the lease agreement in Sector 87 which is standard commercial practice.

faqs.question: How soon can I occupy a rented commercial shop space
faqs.answer: Occupation time varies depending on the current state of the unit. Ready-to-move fully fitted shops can often be occupied within 15 to 30 days after lease execution and deposit payment. If the unit requires extensive fit-outs or structural changes the timeframe will be longer and is subject to necessary approvals from the society management or local authorities in Gurugram ensuring all regulations are met.

faqs.question: Are there security deposits required for commercial property in this area
faqs.answer: Yes a standard practice across Gurugram and specifically in Sector 87 involves paying a security deposit. This deposit serves as collateral against potential damage or default on rent. The amount typically ranges from three to six months worth of the agreed-upon rental price and is refundable upon the successful termination of the lease barring any damages and provided all terms have been meticulously followed by the tenant.

faqs.question: What is the parking situation like for customers and staff
faqs.answer: Most modern commercial complexes in Sector 87 provide dedicated basement or surface parking for customers and tenants which is a significant advantage over older markets. High-street shops generally rely on designated roadside parking or small common parking areas. We ensure that our listings provide detailed information on available parking facilities a key factor for customer convenience and business accessibility.

faqs.question: Can I alter the interior structure of the rented shop
faqs.answer: Interior structural alterations generally require explicit written permission from the landlord and sometimes approval from the building management or municipal corporation. Non-structural changes like installing partitions shelving or false ceilings are usually permitted but must be discussed during the negotiation phase and formalized in the lease agreement for your Shop For Rent in Sector 87 to avoid future disputes.

faqs.question: Is it better to rent a ground floor or first floor shop here
faqs.answer: The choice depends entirely on your business model and customer interaction needs. Ground floor shops are ideal for high foot traffic retail impulse purchases and F&B due to maximum visibility. First floor spaces are often cheaper and better suited for professional services offices clinics or specialized studios where the location is destination-based rather than impulse-based relying on scheduled appointments.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for property tax payments on rented commercial shops
faqs.answer: In a commercial rental agreement the responsibility for municipal property taxes generally rests with the landlord or the property owner. The tenant is usually responsible for user-based charges like maintenance electricity and water consumption as per the terms agreed upon in the commercial lease document for the Sector 87 property ensuring a clear demarcation of financial liabilities.
